subs.text: Just realized that "feedBase" has the same initials as you-know.

Could a pardon be obstruction of justice? People say the president is free to pardon anyone. True. He is also allowed to use the phone. But if he uses the phone to threaten a witness, that's OOJ. Same with a pardon. If it's purpose is to silence a witness, it's OOJ.
Just an idea, what if the Dems didn't choose their candidate to run against Trump until say September 2020. Not give the Repubs/Russians enough time to smear them in shit.
I'd like to see a graph of illegal immigration from Mexico over time. I bet it's been going down. My guess it would have started its decline around 2008, when the recession started.
Today is the official unveiling of feedBase.

The home page is the hotlist. Click on the name of a feed to see who subscribes. Click on a user's name to see what they follow. If you see something that interests you, click the Subscribe button and it will be added to your public subscription list.
The next thing to do is to upload an OPML file with your subscriptions. If you have more than one, upload both. We take care of duplicates.
And the technical docs. Including a description of the database, and the feedBase source (it's written in JavaScript of course, runs in node.js).

If you're a developer, here's a feedBase-generated OPML file you can test with. What to do with it? Listen to the 8-minute podcast I posted yesterday. It'll explain the vision. It's a bootstrap. You are part of it. :rocket:
If you have technical questions or concerns, post an issue on the repo.
If you have user questions, you can post them there too, or as a comment on the docs.
I still have more work to do, and there will be more features to add. Bugs to fix. Etc.
